definition: cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
Yantai prefecture level city in Shandong

sentences.english: It soon turned into black smog as the smoke of the city poured into the air.
sentences.chinese: 随着城市的烟排入天空，白雾很快变成了黑色烟雾。

sentences.english: The montgolfier brothers began experimenting by filling small paper bags with smoke.
sentences.chinese: 蒙戈尔菲耶兄弟俩最初的实验是把烟装进小纸袋。

sentences.english: The smoke is stinging my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 烟把我的眼睛熏得很疼。

sentences.english: He took a deep draw on his pipe and tried again.
sentences.chinese: 他猛吸了一口烟，又试了起来。

sentences.english: We had to stuff the ventilator shafts up to stop the smoke entering the room.
sentences.chinese: 为了阻止烟进入室内，我们只好把通风道堵起来。

sentences.english: Does the YSR E-Cigarette have a smell?
sentences.chinese: 使用依思瑞电子烟，是否会有难闻的味道？

sentences.english: He has not quit smoking, but is holding down to three cigarettes a day.
sentences.chinese: 他并戒烟，已减到每天只抽三支烟了。

sentences.english: He had smoked for so many years that his teeth were permanently stained yellow.
sentences.chinese: 他吸了那么多年烟，牙齿都被永久地熏黄了。

sentences.english: He watched it drift through the pine tops.
sentences.chinese: 他望着这缕烟盘绕在树尖。

sentences.english: Bouquet: Excellent concentration. Berry nose with vanilla flavours and complex oakiness.
sentences.chinese: 浓醇度，芳香带浓厚果味，有香料和烟的香气。

sentences.english: He always has a smoke after dinner, and makes the room smoky .
sentences.chinese: 他饭后总是吸支烟，弄得屋子满是烟雾。

sentences.english: "He's crying because he wants a cigarette," said Diana, his mother.
sentences.chinese: “他哭是因为他想要一支烟，”他母亲黛安娜说。

sentences.english: Smoke from the camp-fires spiraled up into a clear sky.
sentences.chinese: 营火冒出的烟袅袅升上明净的天空。

sentences.english: This new age mobile application Egg Timer will keep you roast tender and the smoke away.
sentences.chinese: 这个新时代的移动应用煮蛋计时器将让您烤嫩和烟了。

sentences.english: Your fingers are brown. You've been smoking too much.
sentences.chinese: 你手指都黄了，你烟抽得太多了。

sentences.english: Between the acts you go out for a smoke and a breath of fresh air.
sentences.chinese: 你在两个节目之间出去抽支烟，呼吸一下新鲜空气。

definition: to draw out/to pull out from in between/to remove part of the whole/(of certain plants) to sprout or bud/to whip or thrash
to swallow clouds and blow out fog (idiom)/to blow cigarette or opium smoke
